intro: Prunella vulgaris subsp. lanceolata, commonly known as narrowleaf selfheal, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring opposite, lanceolate leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces spikes of blue to purple flowers from June to August, which are clustered in whorls along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and waste areas. Its medicinal properties have been historically used for their anti-inflammatory and wound-healing benefits.
